intro: Ulmus changii, commonly known as the Chinese elm, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and heart-shaped leaves that are typically 5-9 cm in length. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by small, spherical fruits. It is relatively drought-tolerant and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Ulmus changii is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and adaptability.
